Its very obvious the city, particular the mayor, is dead-set against any community-driven process.  

The mayor hired Oregon Consensus to help mediate the impasse.  The OC assessment report recommended: 

"To satisfy the goal of widespread and inclusive community access to the process and the information it develops, the working group meetings could be open to all community members who wished to participate as observers who could feed questions and ideas to the active representatives “at the table” over the course of the series of meetings. In this format, discussion is kept manageable, efficient, and productive while the goal of widespread participation is supported."

Well, the mayor wants to control the process, instead, so she concluded that the entire community needs to submit a 3-minute testimony, which is clearly NOT the OC's recommendation.   Don't trust the mayor or the city, they may want to up-zone your R1 property, and ruin your "livability".

Which country's health insurance would you prefer:
Life expectancy=LE, Infant Mortality per 1000 live births= IM, Healthcare spending per capita= $
 
Country A - LE 83.4, IM 2.1, $3713
Country B - LE 78.8, IM 6.1, $9086
Country C - LE 82.9, IM 3.9, $6325



Country A is the country that spends the least, per capita, on healthcare. 
Country B spends the most, per capita, by far. 
Country C is a distant second, in regard to the most spent per capita. 


Country A is Japan. 
Country B is the United States. 
Country C is Switzerland. 

We can do better!

Source http://www.commonwealthfund.org/publications/issue-briefs/2015/oct/us-health-care-from-a-global-perspective
